intro: Cryptangium dioicum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow floral clusters. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun. Cryptangium dioicum is an important ecological species, providing food and habitat for native wildlife.
